verses.roman:
rudra-rūpa dhari' kare jagat saṁhāra
sṛṣṭi-sthiti-pralaya--icchāya yāṅhāra

synonyms: rudra-rūpa—the form of Lord Śiva; dhari'-accepting; kare—does; jagat saṁhāra—annihilation of the material world; sṛṣṭi-sthiti-pralaya—creation, maintenance and annihilation; icchāya—by the will; yāṅhāra—of whom.
translation: Assuming the form of Rudra, He destroys the creation. Thus creation, maintenance and dissolution are created by His will.

purport.content: Maheśvara, or Lord Śiva, is not an ordinary living being, nor is he equal to Lord Viṣṇu. Effectively comparing Lord Viṣṇu and Lord Śiva, the Brahma-saṁhitā says that Viṣṇu is like milk, whereas Śiva is like curd. Curd is nothing like milk, but nevertheless it is milk also.
